paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR V30M variant, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Of the 513 carriers, 477 (93%) had clinical systemic disease with a median duration of 9.3 (5.1–13.7) years.
Affected mother: Men (n, %) 139 (29.1%); Age at onset of symptoms, years (median, IQR) 33 (27–37).
No ocular abnormalities were identified in the asymptomatic carriers (7%).

functional_data.summary: The TTR V30M variant leads to unstable transthyretin protein, resulting in amyloid deposition.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly maternal inheritance shows earlier onset.
variants.evidence_level: High, based on clinical data and familial segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the high penetrance of the TTR V30M variant in the Portuguese population.
key_quotes: The disease is caused by an unstable mutant transthyretin (TTR) protein that is deposited in different tissues and organs.
Ocular disorders in FAP patients are common, and their prevalence increases with disease duration.

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographic data of 513 TTR V30M carriers (477 symptomatic patients).
Number of patients/eyes, prevalence and age of patients with or without ocular manifestations.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR V30M variant was extracted successfully.
